newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on commission, hedge selling.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on commission, hedge selling.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended lower on commission house and hedge selling, traders said.
"There was commission house and hedge selling all day and Cargill was a light scale down buyer of the January, covering shorts," a trader said.
Mar-July spread at $1, Jan-Mar $0.70. January futures crush profit margin rose to -34.95 from -37.80 Tuesday on January soyoil, meal. Volume was 3,054 with 175 hedges.
January canola fell $2.40 to $405 a tonne and March closed down $2.90 at $405.70. About 125 January flax rose $0.50 to $364.20 on commercial demand. Feed peas did not trade.
February western barley slipped $0.80 to close at $138.80 on CBOT corn and March fell $0.60 to $138.90. Volume was 675 lots.

December feed wheat rose $1.20 to $172.70 on commercial demand, March rose $0.50 to $174.50 on commercial and local demand met by commission seling. Mar-July spread at even money, Dec-Mar $2. Volume was 450 lots.
ConAgra sold 20 December oats up US$1 to Pioneer, a trader said.
(All values in Canadian dollars except peas, oats).
